Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, showing one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include a variety of living things in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and animals like lizards or squirrels.
The student can include a variety of living things in the water habitat, such as fish, clams, or water plants.
The student can label the different living things in each habitat to show their diversity.
The student can show comparisons in diversity by including different types of plants and animals in each habitat.
The student can identify patterns in the types of living things found on land compared to those found in water.
